intro: Achillea impunctata, commonly known as lesser yarrow, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small clusters of tiny flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. Achillea impunctata is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
